result.execSummary:
The defendant Greg Scott Hoxtell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Controlled Substance [Modifiers: Penalty When None Expressed-Misdemeanor], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: St Croix County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent with Eau Claire County Case #16CF656.
Defendant to report to Probation today February 3, 2017.
Bond continues until Defendant reports to Probation.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with: Eau Claire County Case #16CF656

miscConds.notes:
$243.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CF399.
$200.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CF399.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
-Not to associate with any users, dealers or controlled substances.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment and/or therapy.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Erica Ellenwood, DF ATTY: John A. Kucinski, DF: Greg Scott Hoxtell appeared from jail.  Court called.  There is an agreement.  Crt reviews and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads No Contest to Ct 1 in the amended complaint in 15CF399 and Ct 2 in the amended complaint in 15CF399.  Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds the DE adjudicated guilty of Ct 1 & Ct. 2 in the amended complaint.  Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:  

- Ct. 1 & Ct 2. in the amended complaint to run concurrent to Eau Claire County Case 16CF656
- W/S 2 years probation with conditions
- AODA and follow through with any recommended therapy or treatment 
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.  
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
- No contact with any users or dealers or controlled substances
- Court costs for Ct. 1 $243.00 and $200 for the DNA surcharge 
- Court waives the fee and the DNA surcharge for Ct 2
- DE to report to probation today 02/03/17
- Bail to remain in effect until the DE has signed up for probation and then it is vacated.  
- 20 days to appeal
Per RMW 1/23/17 - Faxed Dispatch and Sheriff.  eif
Plea hearing on February 3, 2017 at 10:45 am.
Defendant appeared via video conferencing from the St Croix County jail.

CO: RMW & Judge Tolan, RPR: Erin Drost, CLERK: E. Ferrill, DA: Michael Edward Nieskes, DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski,  DF:  Greg Scott Hoxtell appeared from jail via video. Court questions on non-appearance, Defendant was in Eau Claire County Jail. Defendant does not have an address at this time. DA Nieskes is requesting an additional $1000.00 CB, Atty Kucisnski argues.   QUASH WARRANT.  Plea hearing scheduled for February 3, 2017 at 10:45 am.
Signed by EJL on 3/30/2016. c: DA and SCSO. km

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Edward Minser, DF ATTY: John A. Kucinski, DF: Greg Scott Hoxtell appeared.  Court called at 10:40 a.m.  ADA Minser advises that his witness is not present.  State requests a continuance.  Recess at 10:42 a.m. Case recalled at 10:43 a.m.  State moves to amend Ct. 1 to a Misdemeanor possession of a controlled substance.  Court grants Motion to amend.  Court questions the DE.  Court informs Def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands.  DE pleads Not Guilty on all counts.  Court enters the Not Guilty plea.  Set out for PTC.  Court adjourned at 10:45 a.m. lw  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 9, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
